channel.description: Handling User Authentication The time has come for us to finally handle user authentication on our frontend application. There are several different pieces that need to work together seamlessly for this to work properly, so letâ€™s explore what that looks like and see what it takes to get our users properly authenticated so they can access secure data in our application. Pinia Store First, since we want the user to be able to request a JWT that can be used throughout our application, it would make the most sense to store that token in a Pinia store, instead of storing it directly in any individual component.
